intro: Tecoma ochracea var. denudata, commonly known as the naked trumpet bush, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange tubular flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has slender, woody stems and is often found in coastal and sandy soils. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a reddish or bronze tinge when young. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract native pollinators.
